TopicTitle: Look Rotation Vector is zero (unity Problem?)

Articles.Content:
**KSP:** 0.90 Windows 32bit

**Problem:** GUI unresponsive to change craft command or return to space center

**Mods Installed:** 

Dark Multiplayer

Remote tech

Kerbal Alarm clock

ScanSat

Texture Replacer

Interstellar visual mods

Station Science (not used yet but installed)

**Reproduction Steps:** 

Unknown

**Log:** 

not necessary? it just spams "Look rotation Vector is Zero" constantly, IDK how that might help.

Hey all,

So I am building a space station when I realize that I'm not able to jump to other ships or go to the space center, in fact I cant transition to anything outside of the ships display radius at all and only inside of it while using the [ and ] keys. I jump into the debug and I get a constantly scrolling error of "Look rotation vector is zero" on and on forever. I have to force quit the game using Alt+f4 and can then pick up somewhere else using a quick save. The quick save will take me back to the station, which should be a problem right? but it's not a problem immediately. It seems that this only happens after a while (possibly Debug getting too large with repeat entries)?

A quick google search found this but honestly coding is a bit out of my element. ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

[http://answers.unity3d.com/questions/397425/look-rotation-viewing-vector-is-zero-error.html](http://answers.unity3d.com/questions/397425/look-rotation-viewing-vector-is-zero-error.html)

The following mods are active while on this station:

Dark Multiplayer

Remote tech

Kerbal Alarm clock.

let me know what else I can do to try and recreat this problem. and thank you for having a look, any information is greatly appreciated.

I think this is a texture replacer incompatibility with something - I had it last week. I can't remember what the incompatibility was right now though :S maybe it will jog someone else's memory.

Edit: Mine was caused by Ven's stock revamp trying to use TextureReplacer's reflections, simply solved by removing the cfg which adds reflections. No idea what yours would be.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-03T04:30:21Z" title="03/03/2015 04:30  AM" data-short="9 yr">March 3, 2015</time> by Van Disaster**

I had the same issue as Van Disaster.

I flat turned the reflections off using the in-game gui. I like the reflections but not so in love with them that I wanted to track down exactly which CFG (or many) were doing it.
It is a problem with the real world reflections from Texture Replacer, it is best to just set them to the standard reflection module.
